name: Tofizopam
summary: Tofizopam is an anxiolytic benzodiazepine derivative with minimal sedative and muscle relaxant effects, used in some countries for anxiety and related disorders.
description: Tofizopam is a 2,3-benzodiazepine derivative that differs structurally from the more common 1,4-benzodiazepines. It is used in certain countries (primarily in Europe and Asia) for the management of anxiety disorders, psychosomatic conditions, and related symptoms. Unlike classical benzodiazepines, tofizopam has limited sedative, muscle relaxant, and anticonvulsant properties, making it more suitable for daytime use. It also exhibits mild cognitive-enhancing and psychostimulant effects in some patients. It is not approved for use in the United States.

items: Relief of psychosomatic symptoms linked to stress and anxiety

sections.text: Acts as a positive allosteric modulator of GABA-A receptors, but with unique binding properties compared to classical benzodiazepines, producing anxiolytic effects without strong sedation or muscle relaxation.

adult.oral: Typically 50–300 mg/day in divided doses; initial dose often 50 mg twice daily.

pediatric.oral: Not recommended; safety and efficacy not established.

sections.text: Anxiolytic effects may appear within the first few days; optimal effect often within 1–2 weeks.

other: Use caution in patients with history of substance abuse
May cause withdrawal symptoms if stopped abruptly after long-term use
Limited data on use during pregnancy and lactation

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefit outweighs risk; avoid in first trimester
sections.lactation: Unknown excretion in human milk; caution advised
sections.geriatrics: Dose reduction may be necessary due to increased sensitivity

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended after long-term use to prevent withdrawal symptoms.

items: Preferred for patients needing daytime anxiolysis without sedation
Lacks significant anticonvulsant or muscle relaxant properties
Not available in the United States
